SEARCH
Package com.bank.components

Class g17_LON

java.lang.Object
com.bank.components.g17_LON
public class g17_LON extends Object
The Loan class handles all logic and operations related to loans. The class calculates the monthly payment to be made using the Amortization Loan formula. The class includes a constructor, getter and setter methods, along with methods that handles loan related computations. Note: Some setter methods are not included due to privacy and security concerns. Example usage: To build a loan class: Loan loan1 = new Loan("12345", 30000, 5, 60, LocalDate.now());

  • Constructor Details

    • g17_LON

      public g17_LON(double loanAmount, double interestRate, int repaymentPeriod, String loanType, LocalDate startLoanDate) throws Exception
      Constructor. All money related double data type parameters are converted to BigDecimal. Also validates if the loan is within constraints
      Parameters:
      loanAmount - The amount to be loaned
      interestRate - Interest Rate of the loan
      repaymentPeriod - The amount of time (in years) need for account holder to pay the loan
      loanType - The type of loan e.g. House Loan
      startLoanDate - The start date of the loan
      Throws:
      Exception - Occurs if any of the input parameters are not within constraints

    • calculateLoanDetails

      public void calculateLoanDetails()
      Calculates the amount to be paid monthly with interest applied, also sets the total loan amount and the loan balance. This method uses the Amortization Loan formula to calculate monthly payments.
      See Also:
      • Amortization Loan Formula

    • checkIfPaymentDue

      public void checkIfPaymentDue()
      Method to check if monthly payments are due. At the 10th of each month, the bank will request for a loan payment. This is the ACTUAL implementation, however this method uses a separate date so that functionality can be SIMULATED. A counter is used to keep track of late payments. A late payment fee is added if account holder fails to make payment by the next payment cycle.
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - Occurs if there is an issue with date format when caluating between 2 dates

    • payLoan

      public void payLoan(String paymentInput)
      Method to allow account holder to pay loans. The method will detect and return an error if excess payment is made. Deducts the amount paid from loanBalance and outstandingBalance.
      Parameters:
      paymentInput - The amount of payment the account holder is paying in an instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - This exception occurs if excess payment is inputted, or there is a general error when making payment

    • validateInputs

      public boolean validateInputs(double loanAmount, double interestRate, int repaymentPeriod)
      Method to validate inputs before initializing in the constructor. Principle Loan must be more than the minimum loan amount. Interest rate should not be more than 100 Repayment Period should not exceed 1200 months (100 years)
      Parameters:
      loanAmount - The principle (original) loan amount
      interestRate - Interest rate of the loan
      repaymentPeriod - The amount of time (in years) need for account holder to pay the loan
      Returns:
      boolean value FALSE if any of the above scenario match, otherwise TRUE

    • printLoanDetails

      public void printLoanDetails()
      Method to print a summary of the loan
